text: The Spantik-Sosbun Mountains are a group of mountains in the Karakoram range. They are what is called a subrange, or a smaller mountain range inside of a larger one. This subrange is located in Gilgit-Baltistan, in Pakistan. The highest mountain is Spantik, which is high. The other mountain after which the subrange is named is Sosbun Brakk, which is high.Jerzy Wala, Orographical Sketch Map of the Karakoram, Swiss Foundation for Alpine Research, Zurich, 1990. The Spantik-Sosbun Mountains are about long, going mostly eastâ€“west. The northern border is the Hispar and Biafo Glaciers. On the southwest, the Barpu Glacier and the Chogo Lungma Glacier separate these mountains from the Rakaposhi-Haramosh Mountains. On the southeast, the Braldu River is the border between this subrange and the Mango Gusor Mountains. == References == == Other websites == * Category:Karakoram Category:Mountains of Gilgit-Baltistan
title: Spantik-Sosbun Mountains
